definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: When the wicked are in authority, transgression increases, but the righteous will look upon their down fall.
sentences.chinese: 惡人加多，過犯也加多，義人必看見他們跌倒。

sentences.english: God does not, nor will he ever, count such men's sins against them.
sentences.chinese: 神不將，而且永遠不會將這種人的過犯歸到他們身上。

sentences.english: Confess your sins and ask for forgiveness when necessary.
sentences.chinese: 承認你的過犯，必要的時候請求饒恕。

sentences.english: My transgression is sealed up in a bag, and thou sewest up mine iniquity.
sentences.chinese: 我的過犯被你封在囊中，也縫嚴了我的罪孽。

sentences.english: May he then come and cleanse our hearts by his Spirit, from all that defiles.
sentences.chinese: 願他來潔淨我們的魂和靈，遠離我們的過犯。

sentences.english: And their sins and iniquities will I remember no more.
sentences.chinese: 以後就說，我不再記念他們的罪愆，和他們的過犯。

sentences.english: Lamb of God, that takest away the sins of the world.
sentences.chinese: 神的羔羊，你承擔世人的過犯。

sentences.english: They shall eat the sins of my people, and shall lift up their souls to their iniquity.
sentences.chinese: 他們賴我百姓的罪惡自肥，一心渴望他們的過犯。

sentences.english: make me to know my transgression and my sin.
sentences.chinese: 求你叫我知道我的過犯與罪愆。

sentences.english: Some became fools through their rebellious ways and suffered affliction because of their iniquities.
sentences.chinese: 愚妄人因自己的過犯，和自己的罪孽便受苦楚。

sentences.english: Fools because of their transgression, and because of their iniquities, are afflicted.
sentences.chinese: 愚妄人因自己的過犯，和自己的罪孽便受苦楚。

definition: to pray on behalf of sb
trustworthy/reliable/to believe something to be true
Job (name)/Book of Job in the Old Testament
Abraham (name)/Abraham, father of Judaism and Islam in the Bible and Quran/same as Ibrahim 易卜拉辛
